fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44111].
  {panel}

Hello,

I would like to recommend an update to your Note macro. The Note macro uses a symbol that is universally seen as a Caution. Would it be possible to change the name of the macro to Caution instead of Note?

Many tech writers use four main type of notes in their documentation. For an example. please see [Warning and Caution Notes by Sonus|https://support.sonus.net/display/DSCDOC151/About+the+DSC+Platforms+Documentation+Library#AbouttheDSCPlatformsDocumentationLibrary-WarningandCautionNotes]. The change of the name would help improve the use of your marcos and the documentation of the companies that use your product.

Thank you,

- Liz
fields.summary: Note Macro switched to Caution Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44094].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When Collaborative Editing is on and you're editing a page the "_Update published page_" dialog overlaps the Update button itself making it hard to click the Update button to save the changes.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud
This could only be reproducible on all browsers running on Windows 7 (IE11, Chrome and Firefox)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Collaborative Editing enabled
# Access a page and click the Edit button
# Hover the mouse over the Update button

h3. Expected Results
The dialog is completely above the button

h3. Actual Results
The dialog overlaps the Update button
 

h3.Workaround
No workaround on Windows
fields.summary: "Update published page" dialog overlaps the Update button on Windows browsers

h3. Problem Definition

When you have a page with Page Properties Report macro and you resort the columns then export to PDF or Word, the page doesn't contain the new sorting.
The export takes into consideration the server default sorting and not the new server side sorting.

Add the ability the export using the new server side sorting.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
I installed the latest Confluence 6.0 beta 3 release, and if I configure Confluence to use a datasource Synchrony won't start.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Confluence to use a datasource instead of JDBC url
# Start Confluence
# Attempt to edit a page

h3. Expected Results
Editor functions as normal


h3. Actual Results
The following appears at the top of the screen:
{noformat}
There's a problem with collaborative editing. People may be unable to save or publish. Troubleshoot this problem.
{noformat}
!image-2016-09-23-12-01-08-731.png|thumbnail!

When I click on troubleshoot this problem:  
!image-2016-09-23-12-02-17-965.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Solution / Workaround
Configure Confluence to use a JDBC connector
fields.summary: Synchrony won't start if Confluence is configured to use a datasource
The path [synchrony-proxy] does not meet these criteria and has been changed to [/synchrony-proxy]

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44058].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian
We are setting up IIS Proxying for Confluence 6 beta 3 in order to have a working solution/answer about upgrade paths for our enterprise Customers using IIS as a HTTP or HTTPS proxy for Confluence (Fronting Confluence with IIS).
While using the standard configuration as in previous version, Confluence is usable, but Concurrent Editing is not working/enabled.
Could you please let us know which additional configuration is needed to also enable proxying for Synchrony ?

Thank you and best regards
Denis
bitvoodoo AG

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44057].
  {panel}

*Summary*

When we attach an Excel file which consists of many columns or is wide the file preview will break the preview and display it vertically by splitting it.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Attach the file [^Mappe1.xlsx] to a Confluence page by dragging and dropping in the page editor
# Save the page
# Preview the file

Now compare the content of the file when opening in the preview and the original file content  

h3. Suggested Solution
We can have a horizontal scroll bar in the preview and display the preview correctly without splitting the original content.
 
h3. Workaround 
Download the file and preview.
fields.summary: File Preview should be able to handle wide excel i.e. with many column

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Notification isn't sent to page/space watchers, when user adds/edits a comment on a attched file.

User adds/edits a comment on a attachment file(like a pdf) on a watching page.
 However a notification isn't sent to page watchers/space watchers.

When Confluence 5.7, 5.9


|| ||Add a comment||Edit a comment||
|Page watcher|sent|not sent|
|Space watcher|not sent|sent|

When Confluence 5.10


|| ||Add a comment||Edit a comment||
|Page watcher|sent|not sent|
|Space watch|sent|not sent|
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.7
 * Confluence 5.9
 * Confluence 5.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a pdf file to a page.
 # User1 watches the page. User2 watch the space of the page.
 # Click the thumbnail the file.
 # Drag the pin icon from the bottom of the preview and drop it where you want to comment.
 # Add your comment and Save
 # Edit the comment adn Save

h3. Expected Results

Notification is sent to Page/Space watchers
h3. Actual Results

Notification isn't sent to Page/Space watchers against an expectation. 
 It should be sent to watchers, when a comment adds/edits.
h3. Workaround

no workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Notification isn't sent to page/space watchers, when user adds/edits a comment on an attached file

fields.description:
The validation does not work for files that is extremely larger compare to the set limit.

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Install Confluence 5.10.4
 # In Administrations > General Configuration > Attachment Size > Set the size to 5MB
 # Create a new page
 # Go to Attachments list of the page, and upload the file using "Upload file" button in the "Attach Files" section

 

*Expected Behaviour*

Upload attachment slightly bigger than 5MB .Eg: 8MB and the Warning Message will be thrown

!WarningMsg.png|thumbnail!

 

*Actual Behaviour*
 When uploading an extremely large file like 16MB file, it will re-direct user to "This Site can't be reached" as per screenshot

!SitesCan'tBeReached.png|thumbnail!

 

 

*Test Notes:*

 
 * When the Attachment Limit is set to 5MB, the bug is not reproducible when 10MB or 15MB file is uploaded. It can only be reproduce when the file uploaded is 15.1MB and above
 * When the Attachment Limit is set to 2MB, the bug is not reproducible when uploading 7.1MB or 10MB file. It can be reproduce when the file uploaded is 11MB and above
fields.summary: Confluence Do Not Validate Uploaded File Correctly

h3. Summary
The text in the first row and first column of a copied table will appear outside of the table if you copy paste it while using Firefox.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.10.4
* Firefox 49.0 (Current latest version)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page with a table of size 3x3.
# Insert dummy text in each row and column.
# Try to copy paste the entire table underneath the existing table.

h3. Expected Results
The exact table is copy pasted onto the page resulting in 2 identical tables.

h3. Actual Results
The first row and first column of the table appears outside of the table, as seen in the screenshot below.

 !Copy table bug.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
This issue is not reproducible in Google Chrome or Internet Explorer 11.
fields.summary: First entry in table will appear outside of the table when copy pasted in Firefox

h3. Summary
Cannot save inline comment when the page has code block macro or in a table.

h3. Environment
* Windows 10 Professional version 1607
* Edge 38.14393.0.0 or later
* Confluence 5.10.0 or later 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Case 1:
# Create a page and add some text then save 
# Try to add an inline comment then save it. It works (/)
# Edit the page and add a code block macro in the middle of the page then save it
# Try to add an inline comment before the code clock and after (also the table)

Case 2:
# Create a page and add some text then save 
# Try to add an inline comment then save it. It works (/)
# Edit the page and add a table in the middle of the page then save it
# Try to add an inline comment before the table, in the table  and after it

h3. Expected Results

The inline comment should be able to save wherever the text is selected

h3. Actual Results

Can't save inline comment after the code block, in the table or after the code block or table. Error in the screen "Could not save the comment" 
 
Error appearers in the log

fields.description:
This morning I attempted to upgrade Confluence on Windows from 6.0.0-m68 to 6.0.0-m70

I've been upgrading this Confluence with all the milestones using the windows installer.

This time I got an error that was something like 'file still in use', the installer didn't complete, and I was left with most of my install directory empty.

I've attached my application log. All that is left in my installation directory is Logs directory (Catalina logs etc are gone though), and the confluence\WEB-INF\lib and the JRE directory.

We should confirm this isn't a freaky one off.

See also https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-43948

Synchrony needed to be restarted before it was available. After shutting down Confluence and restarting, Synchrony started up correctly.

Logs from the initial installation, and restart of Synchrony using default settings:
* [^catalina.2016-09-21.log] 
* [^gc-2016-09-21_12-43-15.log.0.current] 
* [^catalina.out] 
* [^atlassian-confluence.log] 

Method for setting up Confluence:
# Unzip tar
# Adjust {{confluence-init.properties}} to point to home directory
# Set control port to 8600, HTTP port to 10600, context to {{/confluence}}
# Start Confluence, browse to http://localhost:10600/confluence/
# Complete installation with developer license and evaluation space as per normal

fields.description:
*Please change the JIRA Chart macro so it displays the project name for the Project Picker field.*

To reproduce:
 # Create an issue with a Project Picker field in JIRA
 # Display the issue with a JIRA Chart macro in Confluence

Expected behavior:
 The Project Picker field displays the project name.
 Actual behavior:
 The Project Picker field displays the project ID, as in the database:
{code:java}
select id from project_key;



{code}
The project ID does not mean anything to a user viewing the macro in Confluence.

 

Please see this screenshot for how the project picker field appears in JIRA:
 !JIRAticket_with_project_picker.png|thumbnail!

Here is how it looks in Confluence's JIRA chart macro:
 !Confluence_JIRA_chart_macro.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Chart macro displays JIRA project ID instead of project name for Project Picker field

fields.description:
When trying to store/retrieve custom Java objects in Confluence 6.0.0-beta3, the following error occurs:
{code}
com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.ConversionException: XStream error: Class com.simplenia.confluence.plugins.customdashboards.data.DashboardFilterRule has not been whitelisted
{code}

I'm a bit surprised to see this change, as it has always been possible to store/retrieve custom Java objects in BandanaManager in the past. Atlassian even mentions this in the documentation: https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/development-resources/confluence-architecture/confluence-internals/persistence-in-confluence

*Bandana is an Atlassian framework for persistence of arbitrary Java objects.*

Is this really something you need to change? This is going to break lots of plugins for sure...

Any help/advise would be appreciated.

Cheers,
Remo
fields.summary: BandanaManager is not able to store/retrieve custom Java objects anymore

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to Display JIRA Issue Macro in Confluence when highlighted text originates in an included pgae via the Page Include macro

The following in displayed in Confluence and the link to the JIRA Issue is not inserted on the page:

<JIRAISSUE> has been created, but there is a problem in adding it to the page. You can manually add it later using JIRA macro. by highlighting a Hyperlink text

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure Confluence is connected to JIRA and at least one project is created in JIRA
# Create a new Confluence page (e.g. Page1)
# Enter any text on this page.
# Create a second Confluence page (e.g. Page2)
# Add a Page Include macro and add Page1 as the source. This should display the content of Page1 on Page2.
# Highlight any word in Page2 that originates from Page1.
# Click JIRA Icon and attempt to create a JIRA issue
# The warning happens.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is added on the JIRA side and the link is added to the Confluence page next to the word that was highlighted. 

h3. Actual Results
The link is not added on the Confluence page even though the issues is created on the JIRA side.

h3.Workaround
-Add the link in manually by editing the page
fields.summary: Unable to Display JIRA Issue Macro in Confluence when highlighted text originates in an included page via the Include Page macro

every tip is welcome :-)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In attachment macro, when you hover the attachment the hint or description showing doesn't match the action when you click on the attachment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a test page and attach a pdf,docx,mp3 and a jpg file
# Add attachment macro to the page and save it
# Hover-over each of the 4 links of files in the attachment macro and note the hint/description showing (it's Download for all of them )
# Click on the link of each attachment

h3. Expected Results

As described in hint, we are expecting the attachments to be downloaded.

h3. Actual Results

For the mp3 and the jpg files, they will be open in preview or play mode
For the docx and pdf file, they will be downloaded.
 
notesh3. Notes

It would be nice to change the messaging when you hover-over the attachments link according the action that will be performed.
fields.summary: Change the messaging when you hover the attachments link according the action that will be performed

fields.description:
When using AMPS to run Confluence for Development Synchrony doesn't seem to listen to HTTPS connections. I can go to [http://localhost:8095/synchrony/resources/js/vendor/sockjs.min.js] just fine, but I need to access confluence via HTTPS in order for it to interoperate with my add-on. Configuring Confluence to listen on HTTPS is quite simple, I just uncomment the https connector (defaults to port 8443) in Tomcat's server.xml. How do I make Synchrony listen on HTTPS?

To clarify, I'm not using any kind of external proxy. All I do to access confluence via HTTPS is by enabling the connector in tomcat's config file and going to [https://dmitry.office.lucidchart.com:8443/confluence]

 

Looks like the {{synchrony.proxy.enabled}} flag is {{false}} by default when I create a confluence insance with {{atlas-debug}}. I flipped it on and restarted confluence. That didn't seem to have an effect:
 * [https://dmitry.office.lucidchart.com:8443/synchrony-proxy/resources/js/vendor/sockjs.min.js] returns a 404 with empty body
 * The client still tries to open[https://dmitry.office.lucidchart.com:8095/synchrony/resources/js/vendor/sockjs.min.js]
fields.summary: synchrony-proxy web app does not work when running Confluence using AMPS and HTTPS

fields.description:
MSSQL database have a maximum size of 900 bytes for the indexes according to this [KB article|https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms191241(v=sql.105).aspx].

There are customers receiving warning messages of indexes that surpass the total size of 900 bytes:
{code:java}
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'u2u_relation_unique' has maximum length of 1530 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'u2c_relation_unique' has maximum length of 1029 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx' has maximum length of 1046 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'idx_group_attr_dir_name_lval' has maximum length of 1029 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'idx_user_attr_dir_name_lval' has maximum length of 1029 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'sp_comp_idx' has maximum length of 1020 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.

{code}
Checking the first index for example (u2u_relation_unique), we can see the index is composed of 3 columns Nvarchar 255 types, each one size being 510 bytes. The sum of all 3 is about 1530 bytes which exceeds the 900 bytes maximum recommended value.

If the insertion/update surpasses the 900 bytes (rare but could happen) it will fail.
h3. Possible solution

We should decrease the column size as such the total sum of columns will become smaller than 900 bytes total.
fields.summary: Confluence indexes are bigger than 900 bytes on MSSQL which is not recommended

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43795].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
While using Share button it's not possible to search for users which are in Confluence user directory (internal or external) if they are not assigned to the group with "can use permissions" or do not have "can use" permissions assigned individually.

Such approach is helping to improve user search performance *but* the user can lack this functionality when it's required to share the page in the space with Anonimous access.

h4. Business case
Example business case configuration:
* Confluence and JIRA Service Desk. 
* JIRA is used for user management in Confluence
* JIRA SD customers are synchronized but their group doesn't have "can use" permission (in order to reduce user count)
* JIRA SD is set up for [Serving customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER031/Serving+customers+with+a+knowledge+base]

The following case has happen:
# Big number of customers from the same department created support ticket related to the same issue.
# The support agent decided to write a new KB and share with the customers from that department.

*Expected behavior*
The support engineer can use the embed search in Share dialog to identify the group or user who is in the directory but without "can use" permissions.
*Actual behavior*
The support engineer is getting an empty search result for groups and users without "can use" permissions.

h3. Suggested Solution
Two possible solutions available:
# Include all users and groups from the directory to Share button search (irrelative to "can use" permission)
# Make an option to manually include selected groups without "can use" permission from the directory 
 
h3. Workaround 
Currently no workaround available, just to give the users can use permission.
fields.summary: Ability to Share pages with users and groups without "can use" permissions

fields.description:
h2.Understanding the problem
The MySQL collation check that we introduced in Confluence 5.5.3 will check the database, table and column collation for invalid collation. When an invalid collation is detected, the upgrade will not be performed; and customers must fix their collation before trying the upgrade again. This is a safe operation, because no upgrades happen if there's an invalid collation - fix the collation with the [instructions in the KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-fix-the-collation-and-character-set-of-a-mysql-database-744326173.html].

h2.What's wrong in SQL Server?
The SQL Server check only performs a check on the database level collation - the following query is used:

{code}
SELECT DATABASEPROPERTYEX(<DBNAME>, 'Collation') SQLCollation
{code}

If the collation of a database has been adjusted to the correct collation (but not the tables and columns) the upgrade will proceed, but customers will hit collation problems between when new tables and indexes are created - because SQL Server does not allow mixed collations between columns involved in an index.

This means that customers must roll back, [fix the collation of the SQL Server Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-fix-the-collation-of-a-microsoft-sql-server-database-744326177.html], and then re-try the upgrade again. For large customers, this is a much slower process than halting the upgrade before it has begun (as MySQL does).

h2.Suggested Resolution
In addition to the current database level check, we should use the diagnosis query from the KB:

{code}
SELECT object_name(object_id) as TableName, name as ColumnName, collation_name
FROM sys.columns
WHERE collation_name <> 'SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS'
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'sys%'
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'queue%'
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'file%'
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'spt%'
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'MSrep%'
{code}

If this query returns any rows, the collation is incorrect, and the upgrade should be halted. The error message should direct users to the linked KB article above (that's the agnostic version, and the most up to date).
fields.summary: The SQL Server Collation Bootstrap Collation check doens't check tables and columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43776].
{panel}
h3. Summary

When accessing Confluence from a mobile device on iOS 10 and Safari, the application serves up a login screen that is invalid. This is true for all pages, even with anonymous access enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 5.10.4 (this can also be replicated in previous versions of Confluence such as 5.9.10)
 # Enable anonymous access
 # Make sure the system add-on called the 'Confluence Mobile Plugin' is enabled
 # Access the Confluence instance using iOS 10 and the vanilla Safari browser that comes included
 # Notice you will get an invalid login prompt asking you to login to Confluence

h3. Expected Results

Confluence mobile should open up Confluence without asking you to log in.
h3. Actual Results

A prompt comes up in Confluence asking all users to log in every few seconds.

!Login Prompt.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This prompt only happens in Safari that comes bundled with iOS 10.
 Switching to Desktop version does *not* correct the situation in Cloud, and is not a workaround. Nor is disabling Confluence Mobile.
 Tested in iOS 9 and it is not a problem there.
h3. Workaround
 - Install the [Confluence Server|https://itunes.apple.com/au/app/confluence-server/id1288365159?mt=8] iOS app and use that instead - requires Confluence 6.8 or later
 - Or install Google Chrome or Firefox instead on the device and use that.
 - Or disable Confluence Mobile by disabling the system add-on called the 'Confluence Mobile Plugin' . Please note CONF-40782 - "Disabling the Confluence Mobile Plugin also disables the Workbox - Host Plugin in Confluence 5.9.X" when performing this workaround.
fields.summary: Confluence mobile version serves up login screen even when the anonymous access is enabled

Problem Definition

Confluence could support "drill-down" access of a page that is at the lower level of a page hierarchy without having to provide access at higher levels of the hierarchy. That will be useful if you have an external user and you want to provide access to a single page and not to the whole hierarchy.

Suggested Solution

Be able to configure viewing permissions to single pages. Viewing permissions are currently inherited. It will be good to have the possibility to configure viewing permissions for a single child page.

JIRA Custom Field enhancement request

We want to add a new custom field to our JIRA issues, and need to use a  multi-line text input to capture the data. Unfortunately, the only Multi-line text box input field offers no formatting options. 

This request is for the addition of a 'advanced multi-line' input field, that can be associated with new Custom fields in JIRA.   This 'Advanced multi-line' input field would offer the font, color, and formatting options available with the built-in 'Description' and 'Environment' fields.

Hi Team

As I already mentioned in CONF-43758, I have trouble configuring Confluence 6 behind a Reverse Proxy without the context path.

You removed the part in the documentation [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeap/using-apache-with-mod_proxy-480346967.html#UsingApachewithmod_proxy-complex] , how this should be configured. So is this an issue at the moment and still open?

I tried the old way described in the old documentation, but I retrieve every time a redirect from the tomcat to the context path

*Version 1 - is not working*
 Described here [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-apache-with-mod_proxy-173669.html#UsingApachewithmod_proxy-complex]
 Vhost
{code:java}
ProxyPass / http://localhost:8090/confluence
  ProxyPassReverse / http://localhost:8090/confluence
  ProxyHTMLURLMap / /confluence/
  <Location /confluence>
    Require all granted
  </Location>
  
  ProxyPass /synchrony http://localhost:8091/synchrony

Vhost

Did I missed something?

 Why did you removed the documentation how this should be configured?

fields.description:
When trying to collaboratively Edit a page, an error can occur when the browser attempts to connect to Synchrony. This occurs when using Confluence's internal proxy due to exceeding the requestBufferSize of 4092 bytes.

!image-2016-09-16-17-34-42-611.png!

*Workaround*

To increase the request buffer size, edit <install-directory>/synchrony-proxy/WEB-INF and add the following parameter (after the maxThreads parameter):
{code:java}
        <init-param>
            <param-name>requestBufferSize</param-name>
            <param-value>8092</param-value>
        </init-param>


{code}
Save the file and then restart Confluence.
fields.summary: Cannot connect to Synchrony via Confluence internal proxy

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a page only has "View" restrictions set for users, opening up the page restriction dialog will display all supposedly "View" restrictions as "View and Edit" in its dropdown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page.
# Set the page's restrictions to have "View" restrictions for 2 other users. You yourself will automatically have "View and Edit".
# Navigate to {{Space Tools > Permissions > Restricted Pages}} and click on the 'Padlock' icon to remove your own "Edit" restriction. This means all restrictions on that page will be "View" only.
# Return to view the page again.
# Edit the page restrictions by clicking on the red padlock at the top of the page.

h3. Expected Results
All users are listed as having "View" restrictions only.

h3. Actual Results
All users are listed as having "View and Edit" restrictions.

h3. Note
Those changes will not be applied if you click on "Cancel". However, if you add a new user to the list of restrictions and you don't change the existing users' restrictions back to "View", all existing users will have "View and Edit" restriction and can edit the page upon saving the changes.
fields.summary: Page restriction dialog changes "View" restriction drop-down as "View and Edit" if ALL restrictions for that page are only "View"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Confluence upgrade from 5.6.x to 5.10.x failed if  the  FK9228242D16994414 constraint  missing from space table. The upgrade failed because Confluence is attempting to delete the constraint which does not exist in the table. 

h3. Step to replicate
# Drop the FK9228242D16994414 from the spaces table
{code}
ALTER TABLE spaces
  DROP FOREIGN KEY FK9228242D16994414
{code}
# Upgrade the Confluence from 5.6.x to 5.10.x

h3.Expected Result
The upgrade is successful

h3.Observed Result
The upgrade failed with the following error.The error indicate that the Confluence hit into NullPointerException when it try to delete the  FK9228242D16994414 constraint which does not exist. By right the Confluence should have detected that the constraint is missing and skip the constraint deletion task since it doesn't affect the end result of the upgrade.
{code}
2016-09-15 04:31:27,243 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener] launchUpgrades Upgrade failed, application will not start: Upgrade task com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.DropSpaceGroupTablesUpgradeTask@27091f57 failed during the SCHEMA_UPGRADE phase due to: null
com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeException: Upgrade task com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.DropSpaceGroupTablesUpgradeTask@27091f57 failed during the SCHEMA_UPGRADE phase due to: null
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.executeUpgradeStep(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:229)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.runSchemaUpgradeTasks(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:185)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.upgrade(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:140)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener.launchUpgrades(PluginFrameworkContextListener.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener.contextInitialized(PluginFrameworkContextListener.java:77)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:4842)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.startInternal(StandardContext.java:5303)
	at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:147)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1407)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1397)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.DropSpaceGroupTablesUpgradeTask.doUpgrade(DropSpaceGroupTablesUpgradeTask.java:68)
{code}

h3.Workaround:
Add the constraint back to the spaces table.
{code}
ALTER TABLE spaces 
ADD CONSTRAINT FK9228242D16994414
FOREIGN KEY (SPACEGROUPID)
REFERENCES spacegroups(SPACEGROUPID);
{code}
fields.summary: Upgrade fail when FK9228242D16994414 is missing from the spaces table

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Page tree (left navigation) load times for large spaces becomes increasingly poor as the number of pages in a space increases.

In this instance, the customer has ~60,000 pages in one space and the page tree (left nav) takes ~8 seconds to load consistently.

Other scenarios showed that this might take *minutes* to load as well.


h3. Environment
 * Customer is on Confluence 5.8.18
 * Reproduced in Confluence 5.9.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new confluence instance and add a test space
 # Create several thousand pages within said space
 #* In my test instance, I created ~28,000 pages to test
{code:sql|borderStyle=solid}
conf=# select count (*) from content where spaceid = '1638415';
 count
-------
 28788
(1 row) 
{code}
 # Navigate to a page within the space to observe behavior

h3. Expected Results
 # Page tree / left navigation should take a reasonable amount of time to load (2-3 seconds ?)
 # Page tree loads simultaneously but asynchronously with page body to reduce total wait time on the page

h3. Actual Results
Upon repro:
 # Take note that the page body/contents load quickly, but the page tree (left nav) continues to load for 5-8 more seconds
 # Visually, the main page may load quickly, but it is time consuming to move around the space and have to wait on this for every page load
 # !repro.png|thumbnail!
 # HAR files show a consistent 7 to 8 second delay in loading the page tree on a space with ~60,000 pages
 # HAR files show a consistent 4 to 5 second delay in loading the page tree on a space with ~28,000 pages

It seems to increase with the number of pages in the space, particularly a flat space.

Based on the HAR output, the page tree doesn't begin to load immediately, instead starts 2-3 seconds after initial GET
 !mytest3-results.png|thumbnail! 
 !mytest2-results.png|thumbnail! 
 !mytest-results.png|thumbnail! 
 !har-edited.png|thumbnail! 


h4. Logs
These appear to be related:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2016-09-12 16:35:35,010 WARN [http-nio-8000-exec-101] [confluence.util.profiling.DefaultActivityMonitor] close Exceeded the threshold of 60000 ms: ActivitySnapshot{startTime=1473698063212, threadId=239, threadName='http-nio-8000-exec-101', userId='user@example.com', type='web-request', summary='/display/spacename/page+name?src=contextnavpagetreemode'}

2016-09-12 16:35:35,724 WARN [http-nio-8000-exec-13] [confluence.util.profiling.DefaultActivityMonitor] close Exceeded the threshold of 60000 ms: ActivitySnapshot{startTime=1473698066566, threadId=150, threadName='http-nio-8000-exec-13', userId='user@example.com', type='web-request', summary='/display/spacename/page+name?src=contextnavpagetreemode'}

2016-09-12 16:35:39,834 WARN [http-nio-8000-exec-81] [confluence.util.profiling.DefaultActivityMonitor] close Exceeded the threshold of 60000 ms: ActivitySnapshot{startTime=1473698070020, threadId=218, threadName='http-nio-8000-exec-81', userId='user@example.com', type='web-request', summary='/display/spacename/page+name?src=contextnavpagetreemode'}   
{code}

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43749].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There are duplicate constraints in the database for the {{bandana}} table and the {{cwd_membership}} table.

Table Name:  Bandana
Constraint Name: bandana_unique_key
Constraint Type: Unique nonclustered
Columns: BANDANACONTEXT, BANDANAKEY
Issue:  Constraint and index create duplicate index
Note:  This creates a nonclustered index behind the scenes.  It is basically a duplicate of: band_cont_key_idx

Table Name: cwd_membership
Constraint Name(s): cwd_unique_membership & cwd_unique_user_membership
Constraint Type: Unique nonclustered
Columns: child_group_id, child_user_id, parent_id
Issue(s):  Duplicate constraints,  
Note:  The constraints also create nonclustered indexes, which basically create a triplicate index with idx_mem_dir_parent_child

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove one of the following constraints:
constraints - cwd_unique_membership on cwd_membership
bandana_unique_key on BANDANA
fields.summary: Duplicate constraints and indexes in the SQL server database are redundant

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43745].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Customer is unable to manage stop words in search results of the knowledge base

The workaround suggested is not available for cloud based version due to cloud restrictions.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow customer to define which words the search engine will skip.
h3. Workaround

(available for server based version only)
 # Stop Confluence
 # Download <install_directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/lucene-analyzers-common-4.4.0-atlassian-02.jar
 # Open it (the easiest way is to change extension to zip)
 # Find stopwords.txt file according to your language org\apache\lucene\analysis[en,cz,de,fr,es,etc.]\stopwords.txt
 # Add/remove whatever you need and save
 # Rename back to .jar
 # Upload back to confluence install dir, see 2nd line
 # Start Confluence
fields.summary: Stop words management on Cloud Confluence

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43719].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Customers utilizing the [Collaborative Editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/collaborative-editing-828790374.html] option in their Confluence Cloud Instances find that Draft Changes made to a page are lost if another user editing the page clicks "close" to leave the page and "Discard *all* Changes" when exiting the Editor; this can cause significant loss of work 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an option which allows a User to discard the changes that they've made to the draft rather than discarding the entire shared draft or remove the option to discard the shared draft

h3. Workaround
 * Regularly publish the page so that a version of changes are stored.
 * Set Page Restriction so that only the User has the ability to Edit the Page until changes have been published.
fields.summary: Prevent Shared Draft From Discarding All Unpublished Changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43718].
  {panel}

h5. Summary of suggestion
When a Confluence upgrade requires the Java version to be upgraded as well, there should be a method of checking for timezone changes in the JDK updates. This is because certain timezones are considered obsolete by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), which in turn impacts the functionalities in Confluence.

The IANA is the standards group for the protocols and mechanics of the internet. They're the group that defines [HTTP Status Codes|http://www.iana.org/assignments/http-status-codes/http-status-codes.xhtml#http-status-codes-1], your standard [TCP/IP Ports|http://www.iana.org/assignments/service-names-port-numbers/service-names-port-numbers.xhtml], as well as a globally accepted [time zone database|http://www.iana.org/time-zones].

Should IANA change timezones within different Java releases, Confluence should be able to detect this and make the appropriate changes in the database.

h5. Impact of the issue right now
If the Confluence database continues to use an obsolete timezone to store dates in the database, it will result in errors such as the ones below to be thrown:
{code}
2016-09-02 22:41:40,335 WARN [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.setup.bandana.ConfluenceDaoBandanaPersister] getObjectFromValue Configuration could not be loaded because class could not be found (context: com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobHistory, key: DEFAULT#CleanTempDirectoryJob).
com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.ConversionException: Cannot parse date 2016-05-25 04:00:00.1 FET
---- Debugging information ----
path                : /list/com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobHistory/startDate 
required-type       : java.util.Date 
line number         : 3 
class               : java.util.List 
-------------------------------
com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.ConversionException: Cannot parse date 2016-05-25 04:00:00.1 FET
---- Debugging information ----
path                : /list/com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobHistory/startDate 
required-type       : java.util.Date 
line number         : 3 
class               : java.util.List 
-------------------------------
{code}

This also results in the installation date in the startup logs to appear as such:
{code}--------------------------
Build Information
--------------------------
installationDate = null{code}

And this symptom currently produces a major issue whereby users can't create pages in Confluence [due to the "Create Page" dialog loading indefinitely|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/unable-to-create-pages-the-create-page-popup-loads-forever-after-confluence-upgrade-to-5-x-330793034.html#UnabletoCreatePages(TheCreatePagePopupLoadsForever)AfterConfluenceUpgradeto5.x-Cause2:].

In summary, if Confluence detects an instance to use a timezone that has been considered obsolete by IANA, Confluence should be able to make the appropriate modifications to rectify the issue. This also ensures the impact received by users are kept to a minimal wherever possible.
fields.summary: Have Confluence check for timezone changes in JDK updates and provide an appropriate fix where necessary

fields.description:
h3. Workaround
Download the JDBC41 driver from http://jdbc.postgresql.org/download.html and replace the existing postgreSQL driver in {{$Confluence_Install/confluence/WEB-INF/lib}}

h4. Note
This looks like regression since 5.9.12 ships with JDBC41 and was fixed in 5.8.13 previously according to [CONF-38556|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-38556].

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Crowd SSO users cannot login to Confluence server after upgrading to 5.10.5

after upgrading to 5.10.5, all Crowd using SSO user cannot login to Confluence.

Error message in atlassian-confluence.log:
{code:java}
login login : '<username>' tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting remember me cookie. 


{code}
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.10.5 + Crowd and SSO enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 5.10.5
 # Enable SSO settings in Confluence and Crowd
edit seraph-config.xml 
refer [https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/integrating-crowd-with-atlassian-confluence-198573.html]
 # restart Confluence

h3. Expected Results

Crowd users can log in.
h3. Actual Results

Crowd users cannot log in.
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

1) Login Crowd once, before logging in Confluence.
2) Disabling SSO allows the login by disabling the Confluence "Crowd SSO Authenticator" and re-enabling the default Confluence authenticator:
 # Shut down Confluence if it is currently running
 # Edit the file CONFLUENCE/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/seraph-config.xml
 # Uncomment the default Confluence authenticator:
{code:java}
<authenticator class="com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceAuthenticator"/>
{code}

 # Comment out the Crowd SSO Authenticator:
{code:java}
<!-- <authenticator class="com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceCrowdSSOAuthenticator"/> -->
{code}

 # Restart Confluence

(i) Note that this workaround is to *allow* users to log in to Confluence, however, SSO will not work with Confluence
fields.summary: Crowd SSO users cannot login to Confluence server after upgrading to 5.10.5
